summary: Flexible text renderer supporting translations, formatting, links, truncation and line balancing.
recommendations: Use the `type` prop (`TextTypes`) to select the correct typographic role — `heading1`–`heading4` render `<h1>`–`<h4>`, `display1`/`display2` render `<h1>` with display styles, and all others render a `<span>`.
String children are automatically passed through the translation service; set `translate={false}` to opt out and prevent Google Translate from touching the content.
Use `replacements` to inject dynamic values into translation keys; use `links` for inline anchor replacements with `href` or `onClick`.

Use `maxChar` with `seeMore` to enable a truncated "See More / See Less" interaction — `seeMore={true}` uses built-in translated labels, or pass a `seeMore` object with custom `seeMoreContent` / `seeLessContent` nodes.
Use `maxLines` alongside the `seeMore` object with `seeMoreContent` for CSS line-clamp truncation with a custom expand trigger.
Set `ellipsis` to overflow-ellipsis the text; pair with `maxWidth` and `textWrap` for predictable single-line truncation.
Use `fontWeight` (`regular` | `medium` | `bold`), `color` (CSS variable or hex), `uppercase`, `capitalize`, and `textAlign` for inline style overrides without extra wrappers.
Set `isBlurred` to visually blur sensitive text (e.g. hidden data previews).

Set `allowNewLines` to convert `\n` characters to `
` — note this also adds `notranslate` to prevent FullStory conflicts with Google Translate.
Use `balanced` to enable `TextWrapBalancer` for headings with uneven line lengths.
Use `animateWords` to apply per-word animation styles to the rendered text.
